```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(shiny)
library(reactable)

raw_data <- read_rds("salika.Rds")
```


Search our data dictionary to find tables that have more than two or more fields of interest. You can use regular expressions or fragments of field names separated by spaces. The filter looks in alphabetical order.

```{r}
js_filter <-  JS(
  "function(rows, columnId, filterValue) {
      try {
        //let pattern1 = filterValue.split(' ').filter(n => n).join('.*')
        //let pattern2 = filterValue.split(' ').filter(n => n).sort().join('.*')
        //let fullPattern = pattern1 + '|' + pattern2
        //let regexPattern = RegExp(fullPattern, 'i')
        //
        //return rows.filter(
        //  function(row) {
        //    return regexPattern.test(row.values[columnId])
        //  }
        //)
        const filterPatterns = filterValue.split(' ')
        const searchRegExp = RegExp(`(${filterPatterns.join('|')})+`, 'gi')
        return rows.filter(row => new Set(row.values[columnId].match(searchRegExp)).size == filterPatterns.length)
      } catch(e) {
          return rows
      }
       
  }"
)


js_match_style <- JS(
  "function(cellInfo) {
    try {
      let filterValue = cellInfo.filterValue
      let pattern = filterValue.split(' ').filter(n => n).sort().join('|')
      let regexPattern = new RegExp('(' + pattern + ')', 'gi')
      let replacement = '<span style=\"color:black;font-weight:bold;\">$1</span>'
      return cellInfo.value.replace(regexPattern, replacement)
    } catch(e) {
        return cellInfo.value
    }
  }"
)


raw_data |>
  group_by(table) |>
  summarise(field_list = paste(sort(field), collapse = " â€¢ ")) |>
  ungroup() |>
  reactable(
    showPageSizeOptions = TRUE,
    highlight = TRUE, 
    height = 700,
    theme = reactableTheme(
      style = list(
        color = "#444444",
        fontFamily = "Segoe UI, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif"
      )
    ),
    defaultColDef = colDef(
      filterable = TRUE,
      filterMethod = js_filter,
      cell = js_match_style,
      html = TRUE
    ),
    columns = list(
      table = colDef(width = 200)
    )
  )
```

```{js}
rows = [["d e f,"], ["c a b"], ["i_h_g"]];

let reorderCellValues = function(data) {
    return data.map(function(s) {
      return s.toString().replace(/_/g, ' ').split(' ').filter(n => n).sort().join(' ')
    })
}
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(reactable)

tibble(field_list = head(sentences, 20)) |>
  reactable(
    defaultColDef = colDef(
      filterable = TRUE,
      html = TRUE,
      filterMethod = JS(
          "function(rows, columnId, filterValue) {
              const filterPatterns = filterValue.split(' ')
              const searchRegExp = RegExp(`(${filterPatterns.join('|')})+`, 'gi')
              return rows.filter(row => new Set(row.values[columnId].match(searchRegExp)).size == filterPatterns.length)
        }")
    )
  )
```
